summary: Hi turtle! How do you think the 'jon is a targaryen' will revelation play out? Like would arya and sansa know by the time jon...
question: Hi turtle! How do you think the 'jon is a targaryen' will revelation play out? Like would arya and sansa know by the time jon arrives? Or would bran tell them at the same time? Or bran and sam tell only jon and he talk with sansa and arya after? When do you think dany finds out, right away or after all the starks know? Thanks!
answer:
I’m assuming this is a show question. 

I don’t know what will happen, but I’m pretty firm in my hopes - Jon finds out first, in a private setting respectful of the fact that this won’t (or shouldn’t) be easy for him to hear, and he decides what, when, and how to tell his sisters and Dany.

reblog.comment:
I’m assuming this is a show question.

blog.description: Semi-obsessed with building a Game of Thrones world and finding/making clothing for Daenerys. Why am I so interested in the Sims 4? Why do I care? No idea, but here are some of my efforts! I will post some S4CC, but full credit to any original creators!

summary: “Prince. The man-sound came into his head suddenly, yet he could feel the rightness of it. Prince of the green, prince of the...
caption:
“Prince. The man-sound came into his head suddenly, yet he could feel the rightness of it. Prince of the green, prince of the wolfswood. He was strong and swift and fierce, and all that lived in the good green world went in fear of him.”

-George R. R. Martin, A Storm of Swords

summary: Why do people think that Dany will be the savior of the North that if she leaves the world is doomed.  I don't see any evidence...
question: Why do people think that Dany will be the savior of the North that if she leaves the world is doomed.  I don't see any evidence for it.  I think the savior is Bran and it will be because of him that the threat will be eliminated.  I don't know why people are missing out on Bran.  He is more powerful magically than Dany.  Dany just has dragons which she probably hatched because she burned a woman alive.  That's not magic, that's human sacrifice.
answer:
I’d get Dany stand acting like Dany was necessary because she’s on Dragonstone and Dragonstone has all the dragon glass that is the only material that can kill white walkers but no they harp on and on about her fire hazard lizards, as if the NK didn’t just obliterate 1/3 of them with a single throw.

It’s because Dany can’t command dragonglass and anyone can use it. Dany’s dragons can kill wights but not the White Walkers or the Night King. You need Valyrian steel to kill the White Walkers which is difficult because they’re strong and seem capable of fighting and even if you do, the Night King can take more babies and make more of them. I doubt Valyrian steel can do anything to him as he seems far more powerful than his generals. He was made by the Children’s magic and I think he needs to be undone by someone who can wield that magic and that person is Bran.

An interesting point you just brought up, Dany’s dragons are as a result of human sacrifice, the same thing could be said about the Night King. He was a man turned into a monster against his will and he was given children by Craster as offerings. He and Dany seem to be two sides of the same coin with their ‘children’ capable of immense destruction. Bran on the other hand has sacrificed no one and gained his powers through his own suffering. That’s why he is different and why those ‘Bran is the Night King’ theories don’t make sense. Bran is the antithesis of the Night King. Bran was willing to sacrifice his very being in order to defeat the Night King while Dany dragged her feet after agreeing to help. She isn’t the saviour, she doesn’t have what it takes but Bran does and he will save the world.

tags: as if the north could be saved by anyone other than a stark named brandon
summary: Can dany stans not understand that actually her dragons and armies are not enough to defeat the night king? They make it seem...
question: Can dany stans not understand that actually her dragons and armies are not enough to defeat the night king? They make it seem like Jon has to give her something in return and the north is not offering anything. Why do most of them just disregard bran? Whose whole arc puts him as the direct enemy of the nk?
answer:
Because they spent the last 20 years thinking Dany was the saviour by ignoring everything GRRM and the books have said about dragons and the Others. The show even took it a step further by having the Night King effortlessly kill a dragon and resurrect it, something he didn’t bother with Bloodraven because he couldn’t use Bloodraven’s magic the way he could Viserion.

Bran has been on a journey to become the Three Eyed Raven since he fell. The Night King literally marked him and came personally to kill him. Jon was coincidentally at Hardhome when the Night King came for the remaining wildlings, the Night King came specifically to try and kill Bran. His actor even said he is looking for someone and that person can only be Bran. Last season Bran has been pretty anxious about being prepared to face the Night King and the NK even spotted him in raven form. They are literally equals on opposite sides who have the same type of magic inside of them only Bran is using it for good. If anyone is meant to end the Long Night it’s Brandon Stark. Prophecies don’t matter, GRRM has been too critical of them to be part of the war for the living. No one has seen Bran coming except Jojen Reed who was sent by the 3ER. No one expects a disabled boy to be important even with all the foreshadowing which is why it’ll be him.
